page.title: 16Racial Minorities
page.content: The majority of those who form this group are of Indian or Chinese (Hong Kong) origin. They form a very small percentage of the total population. Adults are in business, (Chinese people having take-away foot outlets, and Indians small general shops) Indian shops are open during the day until quite late; Chinese shops mainly at night. All have moved into the area in recent years. Elder people are first generation immigrants and some adults (especially Chinese) speak little or no English. Some of the children were born in England and they have differing views. One Indian girl likes the friendliness of the people. One Chinese would like to return to Hong Kong eventually. Some families have relatives in England, whom they visit. Native traditions and religions are preserved & families like privacy.
